starting with james cameron's

released in october of 1984. the film

against skynet and their army of

the concept was lofty even for cameron

cameron also admitted that the idea for

the film spawned a successful franchise

25 years ago toy story became the first
entirely computer animated feature and
put pixar animation studios on the map
the film is set in a world where toys
come to life and follow his cowboy doll
woody chucky spaceman action figure buzz
lightyear online about one of those and
an ensemble of fun-sized counterparts on
a quest to reunite with their owner andy
tom hanks voices woody tim allen is buzz
and don rickles plays a clumsy mr potato
head there's also a slinky dashan a
nervous t-rex a wise piggy bank and a
porcelain little bo peep who is woody's
love interest toy story's journey began
as a short film called tin toy created
by director john lasseter lassner
pitched the concept to steve jobs who
owned pixar and jobs agreed to finance
the project at the time the future of
pixar was uncertain so this investment
was seen as risky but jobs being the
visionary he was saw the potential in
what laster had created and of course he
was not wrong tin toy went on to win the
academy award for best animated short
film the first fully cgi flick to ever
win at the oscars and this captured the
attention of disney soon tom hanks and
tim allen were signed on to star in a
feature inspired by tin toy with pixar
and disney joining forces toy story set
the tone for all pixar films that
followed expertly blending humor with
emotional depth and doing so in a way
that was entertaining for all ages it's
no easy feat to create movies that
parents and their children can equally
get excited about but pixar seems to
have this formula down to a science and
has proven their ingenuity time and time
again critics unanimously praised toy
story with many considering it a
masterpiece and one of the greatest if
not the greatest animated films of all
time additionally the film was nominated
for two golden globes and three oscars
and earned lassiter a special
achievement academy awards
four years later pixar released the
sequel toy story 2 which rivaled its
predecessor in critical reception and
surpassed it in box office crows both
films have rightfully earned their place
in the 100 club although toy story 3
fell off a cliff and is what 98 is still
really really good

later 7 samurai
japanese filmmaker akira kurosawa wrote
and directed seven samurai released in
1954 and starring tashira mafune takashi
shimira and kiko tsushima amongst many
others it tells the story of a team of
samurai assembled with the purpose of
protecting a small village from bandits
the film is set in 1586 during the
sengoku period of japanese history a
notoriously difficult and violent era
what makes this film so epic aside from
the 3 hour and 27 minute running time is
kurosawa's use of martial arts
choreography his multi-camera action
sequences and an inspired score by
composer fumio hayasaka it was also the
most expensive film ever made in japan
at the time and became the country's
second highest grossing domestic release
but the true spirit of kurosawa's work
is present in seven samurai remix like
the magnificent seven and ensemble
movies like the dirty dozen the guns of
navarone and more recently the hateful
eight and since kurosawa created the
film yojimbo which sergio leon
unofficially remade as a fistful of
dollars three years later kurosawa
should be credited for inventing the
spaghetti western genre in addition to
leon seven samurai had a profound
influence on directors like quentin
tarantino george lucas peter jackson and
the wachowskis those are some of the
heaviest hitters in hollywood history so
much thanks oh to kurosawa for the
blockbuster movies we know and love
today
wow
roger ebert would add seven samurai to
his coveted list of great movies it was
ranked number three on the guardians
poll of the 40 greatest foreign films of
all time and timeout magazine which i'm
told is not time magazine voted the
second best action film ever welcome to

filmmaker sydney lumet directed 12 angry
men a courtroom drama released in 1957.
it was written by reginald rose and
produced by henry fonda who also starred
along with lee cobb ed begley e.g
marshall and jack warden the film
follows the closing arguments in a
murder trial where the fate of one inner
city teenager rests in the hands of the
12-member jury a guilty verdict means
the death penalty and much conflict
unfolds in the jury's deliberation hence
the movie's title the film was
originally produced as a television play
and after a successful run on the
program studio one rose adapted to
teleplay for the big screen the story's
inspiration came from rose's real life
experience as a jury member on a
manslaughter case according to rose
there was a terrific furious eight-hour
argument in the jury room and he
instantly realized this was the perfect
setting for a drama once the screenplay
was complete lumet was recruited and
this became his first feature film as a
director aside from rose's clever
writing and lamech sharp direction henry
fonda's performance as juror 8 is
considered by many to be his career best
although the jury's still out on that
one considering fonda has 11 films rated

paul newman plays luke jackson a petty

the established pecking order amongst

man on wire is a biographical
documentary that chronicles daredevil
philly petit's high wire walk across the
world trade center buildings in 1974
director james marsh blends actual
footage with reenactments and uses
present day interviews to gain further
insight into the infamous stunt the film
is based on petite's 2002 book the
recounts his experience and the title
refers to the words written on the
police report that led to his arrest
petite is one of those characters that
seems too bizarre to be real one that
even the most astute of screenwriters
couldn't possibly have created he oozes
with personality superhuman skill and
speaks with such an eloquence and charm
rivaled only by that of your host today
